page.title: 16The Dairy Farmer's Day
page.content: My day began at 6.30 with a mug of tea,before fetching the cows up the road for milking."Boadicea 12" is "at bull" so I must ring the A.I.Centre.I take the cows back to graze. Home to breakfast.Back to the farm. Hose down the cowshed.Clean the bulk tank.Feed the calves.Check the young stock in the fields.Fill the tractors with diesel, storage tank is low,must order some more.I spend the morning mowing grass for hay.After lunch I unload 3 trailers of haybales and stack in barn.A Ministry Dairy Inspector comes to check milking premises and equipment.A "rep" calls for cattle- feed order and cheque.Time for after- noon milking.Dinner at 6.00.Back to the farm to load and stack more bales. 9.00 return home,listen to the news and weather forecast.
